text: Triumph of the hordes. Next segment!
But really, it’s a good suggestion. I hate when games drag out and someone needs to win the game eventually. The sooner someone wins the sooner you get to shuffle and play again

I think it could be good to talk about the different types of winning. Like Dana on the last episode talked about Purphoros and how he felt about winning with it. 
So you could have different sections talkin about winning with infinites, the cards that are often viewed as “Win-Button” spells (Insurrection, T&N, Expropriate, Hailfire) and then win cons that don’t fall into those categories
I think there’s a lot that can be unpacked for that
Yeah for sure
And despite feeling bad I did win games with Torment in Vegas
If you’re not gong infinite mana and knocking people for 20+ with torment I don’t feel bad losing that way.
im fine with exsanguinate / torment, etc.
you didnt lose because of exsanguinate, it’s because you let someone caged sun, then cabal coffers, then vesuva cabal coffers, then cast a spell that can be easily countered
[[spell pierce]]

attachments.fallback: Spell Pierce {U} // Instant // Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {2}.
attachments.text:
Instant
Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {2}.
_"A fool's fire is quickly quenched." —Shaper Kumena_
attachments.title: Spell Pierce {U}

text: one story i tell all the time is this guy getting salty about me winning with exsanguinate, and i told him “you didn’t lose because of exsanguinate, you lost because of my caged sun and cabal coffers” — then i pointed out that if he hadn’t tapped out, including his strip mine, and instead just killed my cabal coffers he would have been fine
i dont understand why people dont kill cabal coffers
same reason why people dont pay the one for rhystic study just because they want to be able to get that random card out on the board that does nothing.
just strip mine the thing ffs
or vindicate, or whatever. so many answers
I really liked playing Don's decks
I was overmatched most of the time, but not cEDH overmatched. A challenge is good.
I don't think I'd like that meta as my main one, but it was a nice change of pace
that’s a good compliment thnx
<@U3MTJRAQL> loved your idea about “scaling with the game” for Boros. Crescendo of War and Assemble the Legion are good, but I would love to see more of those effects

Can’t take all the credit, Matt discussed those scaling things too. 

But yes I genuinely think that’s one of the best ways to handle those colors. Card advantage doesn’t mean only cards in hand. 

I’m a little more sour about it off the air, but “red and white aren’t competitive” attitudes are often touted by people that hate Serra Ascendant, Insurrection, and Purphoros because they’re “unfair” :face_with_raised_eyebrow:

And armeggedon lol
I played a few 1v1 games this past weekend and 3/5 of the games I attacked my opponent’s mana. It’s not “fun,” but it works. I’m also of the opinion every RX deck should run [[Ruination]]

attachments.fallback: Ruination {3}{R} // Sorcery // Destroy all nonbasic lands.
attachments.text:
Sorcery
Destroy all nonbasic lands.
_"We have built a wall upon sand. The wall will vanish. The sand will remain." —Oracle en-Vec_
attachments.title: Ruination {3}{R}

text: Maybe not every, but the point stands.
Yeah, Ruination should see more play

On the scaling bit, I think it’d be interesting to see a mana sink with that philosophy

Ex: enchantments enters with a counter

2: add a counter. Activate no more than once each turn. 

Do something for each counter
<@U6YMA7NAV> early on in my career I played against a krenko deck A LOT that played it and Blood Moon. Spot removal and safe mana are in my blood now.
I think my blood moon is in my Krenko deck. I would make space for a Ruination if I owned one :slightly_smiling_face:
Would be good. I despise Krenko from that time period of my playing career
… >.< It's my favorite deck
Also: <https://twitter.com/dm_cross/status/1008832956566327296>

attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/dm_cross|@dm_cross>: Alright, let's have a quick #MTG Opinion Poll:

Ruination (3R, Sorcery, Destroy all nonbasic lands.) is criminally underplayed (3011 decks as opposed to 61+k for something like Sad Robot) in #MTGEDH and is 100% an "okay" version of "MLD". #MagicTheGathering

text: There’s a lot of reasons that go into my feelings. Most of it boil down to it was fairly tuned and the the best by a far margin in a meta that was just getting into the game
Ehhhh… I don't think mine is "finely" tuned, but it is my strongest deck. SCGCon, I played it once and T4 won and there was a cEDH deck at the table. I play it very sparingly, though.
You know, commander time did a whole episode on basically this, about card advantage, and what it means to archetypes
If you guys wanted to dig really deep into it, I was the one who did most of the building blocks to the episode
I really need to give more Podcasts a chance
I'm a very visual person. My mind wanders to stuff when it's just audio
Phone sex lines don’t work anymore is what he’s saying
Should just start yelling “pay attention Seth” in the middle of these then
Oh man. That'd be hilarious.
